008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch04_Filters;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * ImageJ plugin for a linear filter with a kernel of arbitrary size and integer
018 * coefficients (naive implementation).
019 * The filter kernel is a 2D {@code int} array of size
020 * (2K+1)Ã—(2L+1) with the origin at the center. The summation variable
021 * {@code sum} is also defined as an integer (int), which is scaled by a constant factor
022 * {@code s} and rounded to the new pixel value {@code q}. 
023 * Note that the border pixels are not modified. 
024 * See Sec. 4.2 (Prog. 4.3) of [1] for additional details.
025 * </p>
026 * <p>
027 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>DDigital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
028 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
029 * </p>
030 * 
031 * @author WB
032 *
033 */
034public class Filter_Arbitrary implements PlugInFilter {
035
036    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
037        return DOES_8G;
038    }
039
040    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
041        int M = ip.getWidth();
042        int N = ip.getHeight();
043        
044        // arbitrary filter kernel of size (2K + 1) x (2L + 1):
045        int[][] H = {
046            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0},
047            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
048            {1,1,1,1,1,1,1},
049            {0,1,1,1,1,1,0},
050            {0,0,1,1,1,0,0}};
051        
052        double s = 1.0 / 23;    // normalization factor (sum of filter coefficients is 23)
053        
054        // H[L][K] is the center element of H:
055        int K = (H[0].length - 1) / 2;  // K = 3 (x-center of kernel H)
056        int L = (H.length - 1) / 2;             // L = 2 (y-center of kernel H)
057        
058        ImageProcessor copy = ip.duplicate();
059
060        for (int u = K; u <= M - K - 1; u++) {
061                for (int v = L; v <= N - L - 1; v++) {
062                // compute filter result for position (u, v):
063                int sum = 0;
064                for (int i = -K; i <= K; i++) {
065                        for (int j = -L; j <= L; j++) {
066                                                int p = copy.getPixel(u + i, v + j);
067                                                int c = H[j + L][i + K];
068                        sum = sum + c * p;
069                    }
070                }
071                int q = (int) Math.round(s * sum);
072                // clamp result:
073                if (q < 0)   q = 0;
074                if (q > 255) q = 255;
075                ip.putPixel(u, v, q);
076            }
077        }
078    }
079
080}
